tachyon.client.keyvalue

Interface Index

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LinearProbingIndex

    public interface Index
    Interface of key-value index. An implementation of this interface is supposed to index keys and capable of returning value of a given key from payload buffer.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int byteCount() 
      ByteBuffer get(ByteBuffer key, PayloadReader reader)
      Gets the bytes of value given the key and payload storage reader.
      byte[] getBytes() 
      int keyCount() 
      Iterator<ByteBuffer> keyIterator(PayloadReader reader)
      Gets an iterator to iterate over all keys.
      ByteBuffer nextKey(ByteBuffer currentKey, PayloadReader reader)
      Gets the next key relative to the current provided key.
      boolean put(byte[] key, byte[] value, PayloadWriter writer)
      Puts a key into the index and stores key and value data into payload storage.

    • Method Detail

      • put

        boolean put(byte[] key,
            byte[] value,
            PayloadWriter writer)
     throws IOException
        Puts a key into the index and stores key and value data into payload storage.
        Parameters:
        key - bytes of key
        value - bytes of value
        writer - writer to store key-value payload
        Returns:
        true on success, false otherwise (e.g., unresolvable hash collision)
        Throws:
        IOException - if errors happen when writer writes key/value

      • get

        ByteBuffer get(ByteBuffer key,
               PayloadReader reader)
        throws IOException
        Gets the bytes of value given the key and payload storage reader.
        Parameters:
        key - bytes of key
        reader - reader to access key-value payload
        Returns:
        ByteBuffer of value, or null if not found
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getBytes

        byte[] getBytes()
        Returns:
        byte array which contains raw bytes of this index

      • byteCount

        int byteCount()
        Returns:
        size of this index in bytes

      • keyCount

        int keyCount()
        Returns:
        the number of keys inserted

      • nextKey

        ByteBuffer nextKey(ByteBuffer currentKey,
                   PayloadReader reader)
        Gets the next key relative to the current provided key.

        This could be more efficient than iterating over keyIterator(PayloadReader) to find the next key.

        Parameters:
        currentKey - the current key, or null if there is no initial key known yet
        reader - reader to access key-value payload
        Returns:
        the next key, or null if there are no remaining keys

      • keyIterator

        Iterator<ByteBuffer> keyIterator(PayloadReader reader)
        Gets an iterator to iterate over all keys.

        This could be more efficient than repeatedly calling nextKey(ByteBuffer, PayloadReader).

        Parameters:
        reader - reader to access key-value payload
        Returns:
        an iterator of keys, the iterator does not support remove
